channel.title: Better Emote system

item.title: Better Emote system
item.dc:creator: @lurtz1230 lurtz1230
item.description:
@lurtz1230 wrote:

zyle1992:

I’d personally use a Map<Button id, emote id> or something similar (although it should be more dynamic than that).

Yes, you could actually have a map containing objects that would have abstract methods that would be called if the player pressed the specific button that its key was in the map. It would be pretty fast since it would be O(1) and each button could do different things besides different emotes.

[quote=“whackatre, post:15, topic:442194”][quote author=Int Bauk link=topic=544838.msg3994549#msg3994549 date=1337094942]

I liked your use of enums in your EmoteHandler class. Why not use them in the ClickingButtons snippet?

Why put it there when it will just clutter it with more space, here now clickingbuttons is smaller and you only add one method at the end of the switch statement.

I’m not talking about the enums.

I liked your use of enums in your EmoteHandler class. Why not use them in the ClickingButtons snippet?

what dafuq… /facepalm

as said, like the use of your enums: but at the end of the day it is kind of pointless creating a whole new class, instance etc just for an animation.

good job otherwise.

If you’re going to facepalm me, at least explain how the use of multiple unnecessary switch statements are better than enums/multidimensional arrays/a hashmap?

if you read what i said, i already answered what you asked…
[/quote]

Don’t see it. You only gave your opinion stating that it was ‘pointless’ to create a whole new class just for animations. You didn’t answer my question why multiple switch statements are better than enums/multidimensional arrays/hashmaps.[/quote]

Why does every mopar topic have to have people argue over the littlest things…

Read full topic

Why put it there when it will just clutter it with more space, here now clickingbuttons is smaller and you only add one method at the end of the switch statement.

I’m not talking about the enums.

what dafuq… /facepalm

as said, like the use of your enums: but at the end of the day it is kind of pointless creating a whole new class, instance etc just for an animation.

good job otherwise.

If you’re going to facepalm me, at least explain how the use of multiple unnecessary switch statements are better than enums/multidimensional arrays/a hashmap?
[/quote]

if you read what i said, i already answered what you asked…[/quote]

Don’t see it. You only gave your opinion stating that it was ‘pointless’ to create a whole new class just for animations. You didn’t answer my question why multiple switch statements are better than enums/multidimensional arrays/hashmaps.

item.title: Better Emote system
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Tehlife, post:8, topic:442194”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=544838.msg3994060#msg3994060 date=1337024781]
dont see hows it better
[/quote]

You dont see how this:

[code]package server.model.players.Content;

import server.model.players.;
import java.util.;

/**

  • @Author - “TheLife” on Rune-Server and “TehLife” on Moparscape
    */

public class EmoteHandler {

    private final Client c;
    
    public EmoteHandler(Client c) {
            this.c = c;        
    }
    
    public Emotes EMOTES = null;
    
    public enum Emotes {
        Yes        (168, 855, -1),
        No        (169, 856, -1),
        Bow        (164, 858, -1),
        Angry        (167, 864, -1), 
        Think (162, 857, -1),
        Wave        (163, 863, -1),
        Shrug        (52058, 2113, -1),
        Cheer        (171, 862, -1),
        Beckon        (165, 859, -1), 
        Laugh (170, 861, -1),
        Jump_For_Joy        (52054, 2109, -1),
        Yawn        (52056, 2111, -1),
        Dance        (166, 866, -1),
        Jig        (52051, 2106, -1), 
        Twirl (52052, 2107, -1),
        Headbang        (52053, 2108, -1),
        Cry        (161, 860, -1),
        Blow_Kiss        (43092, 0x558, 574),
        Panic        (52050, 2105, -1), 
        Rasberry (52055, 2110, -1),    
        Clap        (172, 865, -1),
        Salute        (52057, 2112, -1),
        Goblin_Bow        (52071, 0x84F, -1),
        Goblin_Salute        (52072, 0x850, -1), 
        Glass_Box (2155, 0x46B, -1),
        Climb_Rope        (25103, 0x46A, -1),
        Lean        (25106, 0x469, -1),
        Glass_Wall        (2154, 0x468, -1),
        Idea        (88060, 4276, 712), 
        Stomp (88061, 4278, -1),
        Flap        (88062, 4280, -1),
        Slap_Head        (88063, 4275, -1),
        Zombie_Walk        (72032, 3544, -1),
        Zombie_Dance        (72033, 3543, -1), 
        Zombie_Hand (88065, 7272, 1244),
        Scared        (59062, 2836, -1),
        Bunny_Hop        (72254, 6111, -1),
        Skillcape        (74108, 1, 1);
        
            private Emotes(int buttonId,int animId, int gfxId) {
                    this.buttonID = buttonId;
                    this.animID = animId;
                    this.gfxID = gfxId;
            }
            public static HashMap <Integer, Emotes> emotes = new HashMap<Integer, Emotes>();
            
            public static Emotes loadEmote(int buttonId) {
                    return emotes.get(buttonId);
            }
            static {
                    for (Emotes e : Emotes.values())
                            emotes.put(e.buttonID, e);
            }
            
            
            public int gfxID;
            public int animID;
            public int buttonID;
    }
    
    public void startEmote(int buttonId) {
            Emotes EMOTES = Emotes.loadEmote(buttonId);
            if(EMOTES != null && this.EMOTES == null) {
                    this.EMOTES = EMOTES;
                    if(EMOTES.animID != 1) {
                    c.startAnimation(EMOTES.animID);
            if(EMOTES.gfxID != -1)
                    c.gfx0(EMOTES.gfxID);
                    } else {
                            doSkillcapeEmote(c);
                    }
                    EMOTES = null;
                    this.EMOTES = null;
            }
    }
    
    public static int[][] skillcapeData = {
            {9747, 823, 4959}, {9750, 828, 4981}, {9753, 824, 4961}, {9756, 832, 4973}, {9759, 829, 4979},
            {9762, 813, 4939}, {9765, 817, 4947}, {9771, 830, 4977}, {9774, 835, 4969}, {9777, 826, 4965}, 
            {9780, 818, 4949}, {9783, 812, 4937}, {9786, 827, 4967}, {9789, 820, 4953}, {9792, 814, 4941},
            {9795, 815, 4943}, {9798, 819, 4951}, {9801, 821, 4955}, {9804, 831, 4975}, {9807, 822, 4957}, 
            {9810, 825, 4963}, {9948, 907, 5158}, {9813, 816, 4945},
    };
    
    public static void doSkillcapeEmote(Client c) {
            if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9768 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9769) {
                    c.gfx0(c.playerAppearance[0] == 0 ? 833 : 834);
                    c.startAnimation(4971);
                    return;
            }
            for(int i = 0; i < skillcapeData.length; i++) {
                    if(c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] || c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] + 1) {
                            c.startAnimation(skillcapeData[i][2]);
                            c.gfx0(skillcapeData[i][1]);
                            c.stopMovement();
                            c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
                            
                    }
            }
    }

}[/code]

is better than this? :

case 52053://headbang c.startAnimation(2108);// break; case 52054://jump for joy c.startAnimation(2109); break; case 52055://raspberry c.startAnimation(2110); break; case 52056://yawn c.startAnimation(2111); break; case 52057://salute c.startAnimation(2112);// break; case 52058://shrug c.startAnimation(2113); break; case 43092://blow kiss c.startAnimation(0x558); c.gfx0(574); break; case 2155://glass box c.startAnimation(0x46B); break; case 25103://climb rope c.startAnimation(0x46A);// break; case 25106://lean c.startAnimation(0x469); break; case 2154://glass wall c.startAnimation(0x468); break; case 52071://goblin bow c.startAnimation(0x84F); break; case 52072://goblin salute c.startAnimation(0x850);// break;[/quote]

I don’t since I prefer using a switch, either with or without arrays.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Emote system
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Tehlife, post:8, topic:442194”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=544838.msg3994060#msg3994060 date=1337024781]
dont see hows it better
[/quote]

You dont see how this:

[code]package server.model.players.Content;

import server.model.players.;
import java.util.;

/**

  • @Author - “TheLife” on Rune-Server and “TehLife” on Moparscape
    */

public class EmoteHandler {

    private final Client c;
    
    public EmoteHandler(Client c) {
            this.c = c;        
    }
    
    public Emotes EMOTES = null;
    
    public enum Emotes {
        Yes        (168, 855, -1),
        No        (169, 856, -1),
        Bow        (164, 858, -1),
        Angry        (167, 864, -1), 
        Think (162, 857, -1),
        Wave        (163, 863, -1),
        Shrug        (52058, 2113, -1),
        Cheer        (171, 862, -1),
        Beckon        (165, 859, -1), 
        Laugh (170, 861, -1),
        Jump_For_Joy        (52054, 2109, -1),
        Yawn        (52056, 2111, -1),
        Dance        (166, 866, -1),
        Jig        (52051, 2106, -1), 
        Twirl (52052, 2107, -1),
        Headbang        (52053, 2108, -1),
        Cry        (161, 860, -1),
        Blow_Kiss        (43092, 0x558, 574),
        Panic        (52050, 2105, -1), 
        Rasberry (52055, 2110, -1),    
        Clap        (172, 865, -1),
        Salute        (52057, 2112, -1),
        Goblin_Bow        (52071, 0x84F, -1),
        Goblin_Salute        (52072, 0x850, -1), 
        Glass_Box (2155, 0x46B, -1),
        Climb_Rope        (25103, 0x46A, -1),
        Lean        (25106, 0x469, -1),
        Glass_Wall        (2154, 0x468, -1),
        Idea        (88060, 4276, 712), 
        Stomp (88061, 4278, -1),
        Flap        (88062, 4280, -1),
        Slap_Head        (88063, 4275, -1),
        Zombie_Walk        (72032, 3544, -1),
        Zombie_Dance        (72033, 3543, -1), 
        Zombie_Hand (88065, 7272, 1244),
        Scared        (59062, 2836, -1),
        Bunny_Hop        (72254, 6111, -1),
        Skillcape        (74108, 1, 1);
        
            private Emotes(int buttonId,int animId, int gfxId) {
                    this.buttonID = buttonId;
                    this.animID = animId;
                    this.gfxID = gfxId;
            }
            public static HashMap <Integer, Emotes> emotes = new HashMap<Integer, Emotes>();
            
            public static Emotes loadEmote(int buttonId) {
                    return emotes.get(buttonId);
            }
            static {
                    for (Emotes e : Emotes.values())
                            emotes.put(e.buttonID, e);
            }
            
            
            public int gfxID;
            public int animID;
            public int buttonID;
    }
    
    public void startEmote(int buttonId) {
            Emotes EMOTES = Emotes.loadEmote(buttonId);
            if(EMOTES != null && this.EMOTES == null) {
                    this.EMOTES = EMOTES;
                    if(EMOTES.animID != 1) {
                    c.startAnimation(EMOTES.animID);
            if(EMOTES.gfxID != -1)
                    c.gfx0(EMOTES.gfxID);
                    } else {
                            doSkillcapeEmote(c);
                    }
                    EMOTES = null;
                    this.EMOTES = null;
            }
    }
    
    public static int[][] skillcapeData = {
            {9747, 823, 4959}, {9750, 828, 4981}, {9753, 824, 4961}, {9756, 832, 4973}, {9759, 829, 4979},
            {9762, 813, 4939}, {9765, 817, 4947}, {9771, 830, 4977}, {9774, 835, 4969}, {9777, 826, 4965}, 
            {9780, 818, 4949}, {9783, 812, 4937}, {9786, 827, 4967}, {9789, 820, 4953}, {9792, 814, 4941},
            {9795, 815, 4943}, {9798, 819, 4951}, {9801, 821, 4955}, {9804, 831, 4975}, {9807, 822, 4957}, 
            {9810, 825, 4963}, {9948, 907, 5158}, {9813, 816, 4945},
    };
    
    public static void doSkillcapeEmote(Client c) {
            if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9768 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9769) {
                    c.gfx0(c.playerAppearance[0] == 0 ? 833 : 834);
                    c.startAnimation(4971);
                    return;
            }
            for(int i = 0; i < skillcapeData.length; i++) {
                    if(c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] || c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] + 1) {
                            c.startAnimation(skillcapeData[i][2]);
                            c.gfx0(skillcapeData[i][1]);
                            c.stopMovement();
                            c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
                            
                    }
            }
    }

}[/code]

is better than this? :

case 52053://headbang c.startAnimation(2108);// break; case 52054://jump for joy c.startAnimation(2109); break; case 52055://raspberry c.startAnimation(2110); break; case 52056://yawn c.startAnimation(2111); break; case 52057://salute c.startAnimation(2112);// break; case 52058://shrug c.startAnimation(2113); break; case 43092://blow kiss c.startAnimation(0x558); c.gfx0(574); break; case 2155://glass box c.startAnimation(0x46B); break; case 25103://climb rope c.startAnimation(0x46A);// break; case 25106://lean c.startAnimation(0x469); break; case 2154://glass wall c.startAnimation(0x468); break; case 52071://goblin bow c.startAnimation(0x84F); break; case 52072://goblin salute c.startAnimation(0x850);// break;[/quote]
no because your still allocating a hashmap, and when any button that isn’t handled is called it has to loop through the whole map of enums for that button which can be a hassle if you have 100 players online clicking other buttons.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Emote system
item.dc:creator: @Tehlife Tehlife
item.description:
@Tehlife wrote:

imsuperman05:

dont see hows it better

You dont see how this:

[code]package server.model.players.Content;

import server.model.players.;
import java.util.;

/**

  • @Author - “TheLife” on Rune-Server and “TehLife” on Moparscape
    */

public class EmoteHandler {

    private final Client c;
    
    public EmoteHandler(Client c) {
            this.c = c;        
    }
    
    public Emotes EMOTES = null;
    
    public enum Emotes {
        Yes        (168, 855, -1),
        No        (169, 856, -1),
        Bow        (164, 858, -1),
        Angry        (167, 864, -1), 
        Think (162, 857, -1),
        Wave        (163, 863, -1),
        Shrug        (52058, 2113, -1),
        Cheer        (171, 862, -1),
        Beckon        (165, 859, -1), 
        Laugh (170, 861, -1),
        Jump_For_Joy        (52054, 2109, -1),
        Yawn        (52056, 2111, -1),
        Dance        (166, 866, -1),
        Jig        (52051, 2106, -1), 
        Twirl (52052, 2107, -1),
        Headbang        (52053, 2108, -1),
        Cry        (161, 860, -1),
        Blow_Kiss        (43092, 0x558, 574),
        Panic        (52050, 2105, -1), 
        Rasberry (52055, 2110, -1),    
        Clap        (172, 865, -1),
        Salute        (52057, 2112, -1),
        Goblin_Bow        (52071, 0x84F, -1),
        Goblin_Salute        (52072, 0x850, -1), 
        Glass_Box (2155, 0x46B, -1),
        Climb_Rope        (25103, 0x46A, -1),
        Lean        (25106, 0x469, -1),
        Glass_Wall        (2154, 0x468, -1),
        Idea        (88060, 4276, 712), 
        Stomp (88061, 4278, -1),
        Flap        (88062, 4280, -1),
        Slap_Head        (88063, 4275, -1),
        Zombie_Walk        (72032, 3544, -1),
        Zombie_Dance        (72033, 3543, -1), 
        Zombie_Hand (88065, 7272, 1244),
        Scared        (59062, 2836, -1),
        Bunny_Hop        (72254, 6111, -1),
        Skillcape        (74108, 1, 1);
        
            private Emotes(int buttonId,int animId, int gfxId) {
                    this.buttonID = buttonId;
                    this.animID = animId;
                    this.gfxID = gfxId;
            }
            public static HashMap <Integer, Emotes> emotes = new HashMap<Integer, Emotes>();
            
            public static Emotes loadEmote(int buttonId) {
                    return emotes.get(buttonId);
            }
            static {
                    for (Emotes e : Emotes.values())
                            emotes.put(e.buttonID, e);
            }
            
            
            public int gfxID;
            public int animID;
            public int buttonID;
    }
    
    public void startEmote(int buttonId) {
            Emotes EMOTES = Emotes.loadEmote(buttonId);
            if(EMOTES != null && this.EMOTES == null) {
                    this.EMOTES = EMOTES;
                    if(EMOTES.animID != 1) {
                    c.startAnimation(EMOTES.animID);
            if(EMOTES.gfxID != -1)
                    c.gfx0(EMOTES.gfxID);
                    } else {
                            doSkillcapeEmote(c);
                    }
                    EMOTES = null;
                    this.EMOTES = null;
            }
    }
    
    public static int[][] skillcapeData = {
            {9747, 823, 4959}, {9750, 828, 4981}, {9753, 824, 4961}, {9756, 832, 4973}, {9759, 829, 4979},
            {9762, 813, 4939}, {9765, 817, 4947}, {9771, 830, 4977}, {9774, 835, 4969}, {9777, 826, 4965}, 
            {9780, 818, 4949}, {9783, 812, 4937}, {9786, 827, 4967}, {9789, 820, 4953}, {9792, 814, 4941},
            {9795, 815, 4943}, {9798, 819, 4951}, {9801, 821, 4955}, {9804, 831, 4975}, {9807, 822, 4957}, 
            {9810, 825, 4963}, {9948, 907, 5158}, {9813, 816, 4945},
    };
    
    public static void doSkillcapeEmote(Client c) {
            if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9768 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9769) {
                    c.gfx0(c.playerAppearance[0] == 0 ? 833 : 834);
                    c.startAnimation(4971);
                    return;
            }
            for(int i = 0; i < skillcapeData.length; i++) {
                    if(c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] || c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] + 1) {
                            c.startAnimation(skillcapeData[i][2]);
                            c.gfx0(skillcapeData[i][1]);
                            c.stopMovement();
                            c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
                            
                    }
            }
    }

}[/code]

is better than this? :

case 52053://headbang c.startAnimation(2108);// break; case 52054://jump for joy c.startAnimation(2109); break; case 52055://raspberry c.startAnimation(2110); break; case 52056://yawn c.startAnimation(2111); break; case 52057://salute c.startAnimation(2112);// break; case 52058://shrug c.startAnimation(2113); break; case 43092://blow kiss c.startAnimation(0x558); c.gfx0(574); break; case 2155://glass box c.startAnimation(0x46B); break; case 25103://climb rope c.startAnimation(0x46A);// break; case 25106://lean c.startAnimation(0x469); break; case 2154://glass wall c.startAnimation(0x468); break; case 52071://goblin bow c.startAnimation(0x84F); break; case 52072://goblin salute c.startAnimation(0x850);// break;

item.title: Better Emote system
item.dc:creator: @lurtz1230 lurtz1230
item.description:
@lurtz1230 wrote:

whackatre:

I liked your use of enums in your EmoteHandler class. Why not use them in the ClickingButtons snippet?

Why put it there when it will just clutter it with more space, here now clickingbuttons is smaller and you only add one method at the end of the switch statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Emote system
item.dc:creator: @Tehlife Tehlife
item.description:
@Tehlife wrote:

First of all, only thing here which is not made by me is the skillcape emote code.

First add this class:

[CODE]package server.model.players.Content;

import server.model.players.;
import java.util.;

/**

  • @Author - “TheLife” on Rune-Server and “TehLife” on Moparscape
    */

public class EmoteHandler {

private final Client c;

public EmoteHandler(Client c) {
	this.c = c;	
}

public Emotes EMOTES = null;

public enum Emotes {
    Yes	(168, 855, -1),
    No	(169, 856, -1),
    Bow	(164, 858, -1),
    Angry	(167, 864, -1), 
    Think (162, 857, -1),
    Wave	(163, 863, -1),
    Shrug	(52058, 2113, -1),
    Cheer	(171, 862, -1),
    Beckon	(165, 859, -1), 
    Laugh (170, 861, -1),
    Jump_For_Joy	(52054, 2109, -1),
    Yawn	(52056, 2111, -1),
    Dance	(166, 866, -1),
    Jig	(52051, 2106, -1), 
    Twirl (52052, 2107, -1),
    Headbang	(52053, 2108, -1),
    Cry	(161, 860, -1),
    Blow_Kiss	(43092, 0x558, 574),
    Panic	(52050, 2105, -1), 
    Rasberry (52055, 2110, -1),    
    Clap	(172, 865, -1),
    Salute	(52057, 2112, -1),
    Goblin_Bow	(52071, 0x84F, -1),
    Goblin_Salute	(52072, 0x850, -1), 
    Glass_Box (2155, 0x46B, -1),
    Climb_Rope	(25103, 0x46A, -1),
    Lean	(25106, 0x469, -1),
    Glass_Wall	(2154, 0x468, -1),
    Idea	(88060, 4276, 712), 
    Stomp (88061, 4278, -1),
    Flap	(88062, 4280, -1),
    Slap_Head	(88063, 4275, -1),
    Zombie_Walk	(72032, 3544, -1),
    Zombie_Dance	(72033, 3543, -1), 
    Zombie_Hand (88065, 7272, 1244),
    Scared	(59062, 2836, -1),
    Bunny_Hop	(72254, 6111, -1),
    Skillcape	(74108, 1, 1);
    
	private Emotes(int buttonId,int animId, int gfxId) {
		this.buttonID = buttonId;
		this.animID = animId;
		this.gfxID = gfxId;
	}
	public static HashMap <Integer, Emotes> emotes = new HashMap<Integer, Emotes>();
	
	public static Emotes loadEmote(int buttonId) {
		return emotes.get(buttonId);
	}
	static {
		for (Emotes e : Emotes.values())
			emotes.put(e.buttonID, e);
	}
	
	
	public int gfxID;
	public int animID;
	public int buttonID;
}

public void startEmote(int buttonId) {
	Emotes EMOTES = Emotes.loadEmote(buttonId);
	if(EMOTES != null && this.EMOTES == null) {
		this.EMOTES = EMOTES;
		if(EMOTES.animID != 1) {
		c.startAnimation(EMOTES.animID);
	if(EMOTES.gfxID != -1)
		c.gfx0(EMOTES.gfxID);
		} else {
			doSkillcapeEmote(c);
		}
		EMOTES = null;
		this.EMOTES = null;
	}
}

public static int[][] skillcapeData = {
	{9747, 823, 4959}, {9750, 828, 4981}, {9753, 824, 4961}, {9756, 832, 4973}, {9759, 829, 4979},
	{9762, 813, 4939}, {9765, 817, 4947}, {9771, 830, 4977}, {9774, 835, 4969}, {9777, 826, 4965}, 
	{9780, 818, 4949}, {9783, 812, 4937}, {9786, 827, 4967}, {9789, 820, 4953}, {9792, 814, 4941},
	{9795, 815, 4943}, {9798, 819, 4951}, {9801, 821, 4955}, {9804, 831, 4975}, {9807, 822, 4957}, 
	{9810, 825, 4963}, {9948, 907, 5158}, {9813, 816, 4945},
};

public static void doSkillcapeEmote(Client c) {
	if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9768 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == 9769) {
		c.gfx0(c.playerAppearance[0] == 0 ? 833 : 834);
		c.startAnimation(4971);
		return;
	}
	for(int i = 0; i < skillcapeData.length; i++) {
		if(c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] || c.playerEquipment[1] == skillcapeData[i][0] + 1) {
			c.startAnimation(skillcapeData[i][2]);
			c.gfx0(skillcapeData[i][1]);
			c.stopMovement();
			c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
			
		}
	}
}

}[/CODE]

Second of all remove this code in ClickingButtons.java:
(For example)

case 52053://headbang c.startAnimation(2108);// break; case 52054://jump for joy c.startAnimation(2109); break; case 52055://raspberry c.startAnimation(2110); break; case 52056://yawn c.startAnimation(2111); break; case 52057://salute c.startAnimation(2112);// break; case 52058://shrug c.startAnimation(2113); break; case 43092://blow kiss c.startAnimation(0x558); c.gfx0(574); break; case 2155://glass box c.startAnimation(0x46B); break; case 25103://climb rope c.startAnimation(0x46A);// break; case 25106://lean c.startAnimation(0x469); break; case 2154://glass wall c.startAnimation(0x468); break; case 52071://goblin bow c.startAnimation(0x84F); break; case 52072://goblin salute c.startAnimation(0x850);// break;

Under the last Break; add:

default: c.getEmoteHandler().startEmote(actionButtonId); break;

import this in Client.java

Add this:

and this:

public EmoteHandler getEmoteHandler() { return emoteHandler; }

Button id’s might be different for some of you, pretty sure they are not
but if you have to you change this:

Read full topic
